channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: U.S. intervention in Venezuela divides Houston
item.description: In nearly two dozen interviews, Houstonians expressed everything from admiration and relief to skepticism and dread following the seizure of leader Nicolás Maduro.
item.content:encoded:
In nearly two dozen interviews, Houstonians expressed everything from admiration and relief to skepticism and dread following the seizure of leader Nicolás Maduro.

(Image credit: Danielle Villasana for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Frank Langfitt

item.title: Anti-ICE protesters call for national action against federal immigration tactics
item.description: Hundreds of groups hold protests against federal immigration operations, calling for an end to ICE surge. Demonstrators challenge Minneapolis-based retailer Target.
item.content:encoded:
Hundreds of groups hold protests against federal immigration operations, calling for an end to ICE surge. Demonstrators challenge Minneapolis-based retailer Target.

(Image credit: Kristin Wright/NPR)
item.dc:creator: Kristin Wright

item.title: Mine collapses in eastern Congo, leaving at least 200 dead
item.description: The collapse happened Wednesday due to heavy rains at the rebel-controlled Rubaya mines. Congo is a major supplier of coltan, which contains a key component in the production of smartphones.
item.content:encoded:
The collapse happened Wednesday due to heavy rains at the rebel-controlled Rubaya mines. Congo is a major supplier of coltan, which contains a key component in the production of smartphones.

(Image credit: Moses Sawasawa)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Don Lemon and Georgia Fort vow to continue reporting following arrests tied to anti-ICE protest
item.description: The two independent journalists face federal charges related to the interruption of a church service in Minnesota earlier this month. Lemon and Fort say they were there to cover a protest.
item.content:encoded:
The two independent journalists face federal charges related to the interruption of a church service in Minnesota earlier this month. Lemon and Fort say they were there to cover a protest.

(Image credit: Mario Tama)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster

item.title: Judge orders release of 5-year-old Liam Ramos and his dad from ICE detention
item.description: A judge has ordered the U.S. to release a father and 5-year-old son who were taken into custody during the immigration crackdown in Minnesota. A judge previously ruled that they could not be removed from the U.S. for now.
item.content:encoded:
A judge has ordered the U.S. to release a father and 5-year-old son who were taken into custody during the immigration crackdown in Minnesota. A judge previously ruled that they could not be removed from the U.S. for now.

(Image credit: Eric Gay)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: 'Sanford and Son' co-star Demond Wilson dies at 79
item.description: The actor was best known for playing Lamont Sanford, opposite Redd Foxx's Fred Sanford in the hit 1970s sitcom. Wilson died Friday from complications related to cancer, his publicist said.
item.content:encoded:
The actor was best known for playing Lamont Sanford, opposite Redd Foxx's Fred Sanford in the hit 1970s sitcom. Wilson died Friday from complications related to cancer, his publicist said.

(Image credit: NBC Television)
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman

item.title: Milan protesters call for U.S. ICE agents to leave Italy as Winter Games approach
item.description: An ICE unit from the US Department of Homeland Security is playing a role providing security at the Winter Games. At past Olympics, their involvement would have been unremarkable. But after the violence in Minneapolis, many Italians protesting in Milan say ICE agents are no longer welcome.
item.content:encoded:
An ICE unit from the US Department of Homeland Security is playing a role providing security at the Winter Games. At past Olympics, their involvement would have been unremarkable. But after the violence in Minneapolis, many Italians protesting in Milan say ICE agents are no longer welcome.

(Image credit: PIERO CRUCIATTI)
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: Judge says she won't halt the immigration enforcement surge as a lawsuit proceeds
item.description: U.S. Attorney General Pam Bondi praised the ruling on social media, calling it "another HUGE" legal win for the Justice Department.
item.content:encoded:
U.S. Attorney General Pam Bondi praised the ruling on social media, calling it "another HUGE" legal win for the Justice Department.

(Image credit: Alex Brandon)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Kazakhstan's Elena Rybakina defeats No. 1 Aryana Sabalenka to win Australian Open
item.description: Saturday's win marks the second Grand Slam title for Rybakina, who took Wimbledon in 2022.
item.content:encoded:
Saturday's win marks the second Grand Slam title for Rybakina, who took Wimbledon in 2022.

(Image credit: Aaron Favila)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Opinion: Remembering Catherine O'Hara
item.description: Actor Catherine O'Hara, famed for her comedic skill, died Friday at her home in Los Angeles following a brief illness. She was 71.
item.content:encoded:
Actor Catherine O'Hara, famed for her comedic skill, died Friday at her home in Los Angeles following a brief illness. She was 71.

(Image credit: John Phillips/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon
